intro: Didiscus hemicarpus var. rotundifolius, commonly known as the round-leaved didiscus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its broad, rounded leaves and showy, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in swampy or marshy areas. Its fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release seeds, aiding in its propagation. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
